page.title: 11AN OPTICIAN
page.content:
{Opthalmic Opticians}
An optician is a person who tests eyesight and sells glasses. We found that women prefer plastic frames, coloured and the prices varied from Â£8 to Â£50 for the frames. Men liked metal frames; they cost from Â£16 upwards. The youngest person they had ever fitted for glasses was only 12 months old. The optician recommends that you come back every two years for further eye tests. These are paid for by the National Health Service. Most people need reading glasses (to correct long sightedness) when they are about 40 years old. On average the optician did about 15 eye tests a day.
